body:
### Problem

Native LSP completion is currently failing for `gopls`. 

```
Error executing vim.schedule lua callback: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua:311: attempt to index field 'range' (a nil value)                                                                                                                                                     
stack traceback:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua:311: in function 'adjust_start_col'                                                                                                                                                                                                      
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua:362: in function '_convert_results'                                                                                                                                                                                                      
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua:451: in function 'callback'                                                                                                                                                                                                              
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua:390: in function 'handler'                                                                                                                                                                                                               
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/client.lua:687: in function ''                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
        vim/_editor.lua: in function <vim/_editor.lua:0>
```

Per LSP spec `textEdit` can be one of two values and current code is only handling the case where it is a `TextEdit`. 

```
--- @param lnum integer 0-indexed
--- @param line string
--- @param items lsp.CompletionItem[]
--- @param encoding string
--- @return integer?
local function adjust_start_col(lnum, line, items, encoding)
  local min_start_char = nil
  for _, item in pairs(items) do
    if item.textEdit and item.textEdit.range.start.line == lnum then
      if min_start_char and min_start_char ~= item.textEdit.range.start.character then
        return nil
      end
      min_start_char = item.textEdit.range.start.character
    end
  end
  if min_start_char then
    return lsp.util._str_byteindex_enc(line, min_start_char, encoding)
  else
    return nil
  end
end
```

I have some code which fixes this locally and it no longer breaks `gopls` completion.
However, I do not know how wide spread this assumption is across completion.lua. 

If you'd like to submit my fixes for this I will, but it maybe best to have the author of completion.lua address this as they probably understand how far reaching this conflation is. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Enable gopls (golang.org/x/tools/gopls v0.16.2) 
2. Enable native lsp completion (NVIM v0.11.0-dev+684-g53af02adb)
3. Attempt to complete some function. 

You will encounter an error since, for example, gopls returns:
```
{
  detail = "interface{...}",
  documentation = {
    kind = "markdown",
    value = "Action represents an action in any supported filter.\n"
  },
  filterText = "Action",
  insertTextFormat = 2,
  kind = 8,
  label = "Action",
  preselect = true,
  sortText = "00000",
  textEdit = {
    insert = {
      ["end"] = {
        character = 9,
        line = 43
      },
      start = {
        character = 9,
        line = 43
      }
    },
    newText = "Action",
    replace = {
      ["end"] = {
        character = 9,
        line = 43
      },
      start = {
        character = 9,
        line = 43
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### Expected behavior

The completion code must expect either a `TextEdit` or a `InsertReplaceEdit` in the completion item's textEdit field and be prepared to handle both. 

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.11.0-dev+684-g53af02adb

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no, but we need to enable native lsp to produce issue

### Operating system/version

Fedora 40

### Terminal name/version

kitty

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/agriffis/neovim-nightly/

comment_data.body: preemptively opened a pull with the code that fixes it on my end. feel free to close if original authors want to fix this one a wider scale.
As mentioned in #30333, Neovim doesn't set the `insertReplaceSupport` completion capability and hence well-behaved servers shouldn't even be sending these in the first place.

title: [lsp,completion] LSP servers main return  InsertReplaceEdit for textEdit field
